A detritovore, ingesting particulate organic matter. can also suspension feed by filtering with second gnathopod.
notes: (Sakamaki and Richardson 2009) A. spinicorne sorts material with filtering gnathopods.  Abdominal appendages create a water current that is filtered by the fine hairs on the gnathopods, and the filtrate is then scraped off and ingested (Miller 1984; Kozloff 1993)

trait_description: the three species described will desposit and suspension feed. C. spinicorne, C. salmonis, C. insidiosum.

In fresh waters, particularly running waters, they have a central position in food webs, being responsible (along with some cased-caddisfly larvae) for shredding and comminuting all kinds of decomposing leaf litter; hence their classification as detritivores in the trophic economy of lowland rivers.
field observation
in laboratory, commonly univoltine but multiple studies indicate several generations per year in higher temperatures

trait_description: based on field observations. semiannual, iteroparous life history. brooding females collected monthly over one year of the study.
